ratings.comment:
Has a bunch of assignments with really vague instructions and is really hard on grading them. The class is out of 100 points and he will take points off of your assignments for the dumbest things. 

His exams are pretty easy and you pretty much know whats coming. Mostly multiple choice and T/F with a couple short answer.

Avoid

I have never written a review here before but I feel very strongly that students should avoid taking any course with Barry. I'm extremely disappointed in how unorganized the course structure is and the arrogant attitude of Barry. Exams average 40%-50% and he came across condescending when approaching him for help. DON'T TAKE RE306 WITH HIM!!

Barry is a good guy who has relatively interesting lectures but the tests are a complete toss-up and not even worth studying for. This was shown by the 60% and 50% averages for the last two exams. He really have no idea how to teach the class and the grading seemed to be based on a coin flip for homework assignments. Don't recommend at all

Barry gave interesting lectures and you could tell he wanted to help students succeed. Overall EXTREMELY disorganized. Exams should have been curved because they had very low averages. Rather, he gave extra credit which just added more work and still didn't make up for the low exams. You're better off taking with a different proffesor.

A COMPLETE disaster. It was the least organized class I've ever taken, taught by the worst teacher I have ever had in my entire fourteen years of schooling. Halfway through the semester he completely changed the class content and exams were way too difficult. You had no clue what to expect from the exams, and they were extraneous from class content
THE WORST CLASS AND THE WORST SENIOR LECTURER!! DO NOT TAKE PLEASE!!!!! HE NEEDS TO GO! First time teaching and it shows.

Barry was a great lecturer and included lots of first-hand experiences which helped me grasp the content. The class wasn't the most organized but he owned up to it and gave lots of extra credit which was big since the class was graded on straight points. You are going to have to work for an A as he doesn't just hand them out like other professors.

Ive never been in a class so disorganized in my life. I swear Barry nor the TAs knew what was going on during the class. The exams were filled with errors and were also so disorganized and one didnt know what to expect. This man was just mean and arrogant would blame the students for his disorganization and the disaster that was his class.

I have never experienced a more disorganized class in my life. It was completely unacceptable especially for a school that prides itself on having the best Real Estate program in the nation. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH LAUREN LOFTON! Every exam had technical errors and each exam was completely different from the last because the test avg was a 55%.

This was Barry's first semester teaching undergrad students. Attending lecture was enjoyable and offered great insight. He was lighthearted and gave real examples. Exams were horrible and unorganized. Tests had errors and covered material that wasn't covered in class. Students had no clue what to expect for exams and then got absolutely obliterated
He just doesn't care. First time I finished a class not learning anything and it being the Professor's fault.

Terrible course design, I have never taken a college course with such a bad professor. On almost every test there are a few errors with it and or technical difficulties. I would recommend that all real estate majors take this course with a different professor.

This class has no structure. Each test is a surprise and trying to prepare for it is a waste of time. I think Barry is a great guy but not a professor. This class is making me reconsider a Real Estate major. TAs are great and very helpful. Also lecture and discussion materials deviate greatly which does not exactly make sense.

Terrible, terrible professor. Exams are hard and have content we never learned on them. He goes into too much detail for the INTRO real estate course and in reality is just teaching us financial real estate. The average on the exams are low, if not failing. He does not know how to teach and assumes students know as much as he does. DO NOT TAKE

Barry cares that you learn something from this course. From what I heard, the other professor blows it off and gives everyone an easy A. Barry teaches you the concept of RE, and you also get a head start/ look into building proformas & understanding what the numbers mean. If you're a RE major, take this course with Barry-you'll need it for RE Fin

Barry is a funny&respectable guy. He wasn't cocky or "nose up in the air" like some other Biz profs--he likes to joke around & teaches by providing real-world examples from his experience. He's always available outside of class and wants the best for students. He offered a bunch of extra credit & dropped some questions from the exam (points back).

There is a huge disconnect between the lecture material from Barry and the discussion material from the TA's. The average on the first and second exams were 60% and 50% when real estate 306 is usually an easy A. There is a lot of reading, but it doesn't always relate to class. Very unorganized and would not recommend the class with him as the prof.

I think Barry is an interesting lecturer and has a wealth of knowledge that he brings to class every day. There does seem to be a bit of a disconnect between discussion and lecture but as long as you attend both and learn the major themes/homework problems, there should be no surprises on tests. Minimal effort is required if you pay attention.
Barry is a very interesting "senior lecturer." The tests are pretty difficult and you don't really know what to study. I would take it with a different professor.

Professor splits content between lecture and discussion. You have to show up to both sections to all the content in the class. Exams and assignments cover both and are difficult. I've heard other RE306 sections were pretty easy, but you really have to work for a good grade with this professor.
